title: nasapower
text: {nasapower} aims make quick easy automate downloading NASA POWER global meteorology, surface solar energy climatology data data R session tidy data frame analysis use modelling purposes using get_power(). POWER (Prediction Worldwide Energy Resource) data freely available download web interface spatial resolution 0.5 x 0.625 degree latitude longitude meteorology 1 x 1 degree latitude longitude solar parameters various temporal resolutions depending POWER parameter community.

what: Using get_power() to fetch POWER data
title: nasapower
text: get_power() function eight possible arguments returns data frame metadata header current R session.

previous_headings: Using get_power() to fetch POWER data
what: Example fetching daily data for a single point
title: nasapower
text: Fetch daily “AG” community temperature, relative humidity precipitation January 1985 Kingsthorpe, Queensland, Australia.
code: library("nasapower") daily_single_ag <- get_power(   community = "ag",   lonlat = c(151.81, -27.48),   pars = c("RH2M", "T2M", "PRECTOTCORR"),   dates = c("1985-01-01", "1985-01-31"),   temporal_api = "daily" )  daily_single_ag #> NASA/POWER CERES/MERRA2 Native Resolution Daily Data   #>  Dates (month/day/year): 01/01/1985 through 01/31/1985   #>  Location: Latitude  -27.48   Longitude 151.81   #>  Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = 442.77 meters  #>  The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: NA   #>  Parameter(s):   #>   #>  Parameters:  #>  RH2M            MERRA-2 Relative Humidity at 2 Meters (%) ; #>  T2M             MERRA-2 Temperature at 2 Meters (C) ; #>  PRECTOTCORR     MERRA-2 Precipitation Corrected (mm/day)   #>   #> # A tibble: 31 × 10 #>      LON   LAT  YEAR    MM    DD   DOY YYYYMMDD    RH2M   T2M PRECTOTCORR #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <int> <int> <date>     <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> #>  1  152. -27.5  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  54.7  24.9        0.9  #>  2  152. -27.5  1985     1     2     2 1985-01-02  42.1  28.6        0.49 #>  3  152. -27.5  1985     1     3     3 1985-01-03  43.4  27.4        0.01 #>  4  152. -27.5  1985     1     4     4 1985-01-04  48.9  24.3        0.05 #>  5  152. -27.5  1985     1     5     5 1985-01-05  55.3  26.5        1.33 #>  6  152. -27.5  1985     1     6     6 1985-01-06  60.2  27.0        4.88 #>  7  152. -27.5  1985     1     7     7 1985-01-07  63.1  27.2       10.7  #>  8  152. -27.5  1985     1     8     8 1985-01-08  70.6  24.9       10    #>  9  152. -27.5  1985     1     9     9 1985-01-09  60    26.1        2.45 #> 10  152. -27.5  1985     1    10    10 1985-01-10  45.2  27.0        0.48 #> # ℹ 21 more rows

what: Example fetching daily data for an area
title: nasapower
text: Fetch daily “ag” community relative humidity temperature south east Queensland region.
code: daily_region_ag <- get_power(   community = "ag",   lonlat = c(150.5, -28.5 , 153.5, -25.5),   pars = c("RH2M", "T2M"),   dates = c("1985-01-01", "1985-01-02"),   temporal_api = "daily" )  daily_region_ag #> NASA/POWER CERES/MERRA2 Native Resolution Daily Data   #>  Dates (month/day/year): 01/01/1985 through 01/02/1985   #>  Location: Regional   #>  Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = na meters  #>  The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: NA   #>  Parameter(s):   #>   #>  Parameters:  #>  RH2M     MERRA-2 Relative Humidity at 2 Meters (%) ; #>  T2M      MERRA-2 Temperature at 2 Meters (C)   #>   #> # A tibble: 72 × 9 #>      LAT   LON  YEAR    MM    DD   DOY YYYYMMDD    RH2M   T2M #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <int> <int> <date>     <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 -28.2  151.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  43.6  26.5 #>  2 -28.2  151.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  44.4  25.8 #>  3 -28.2  152.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  52.6  24.0 #>  4 -28.2  152.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  57.7  23.9 #>  5 -28.2  153.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  61.4  24.9 #>  6 -28.2  153.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  66.1  26.0 #>  7 -27.8  151.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  45.8  26.5 #>  8 -27.8  151.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  47.9  26.0 #>  9 -27.8  152.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  53.4  24.8 #> 10 -27.8  152.  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  56.7  25.1 #> # ℹ 62 more rows

what: Example fetching interannual data for an area
title: nasapower
text: Fetch interannual solar cooking parameters south east Queensland region.
code: interannual_re <- get_power(   community = "re",   lonlat = c(150.5, -28.5 , 153.5, -25.5),   dates = c("1984", "1985"),   temporal_api = "monthly",   pars = c("CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN",            "ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN") )  interannual_re #> NASA/POWER CERES/MERRA2 Native Resolution Monthly and Annual   #>  Dates (month/day/year): 01/01/1984 through 12/31/1985   #>  Location: Regional   #>  Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = na meters  #>  The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: NA   #>  Parameter(s):   #>   #>  Parameters:  #>  ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN     CERES SYN1deg All Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance (kW-hr/m^2/day) ; #>  CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN     CERES SYN1deg Clear Sky Surface Shortwave Downward Irradiance (kW-hr/m^2/day)   #>   #> # A tibble: 144 × 17 #>    PARAMETER          YEAR   LAT   LON   JAN   FEB   MAR   APR   MAY   JUN   JUL   AUG   SEP   OCT   NOV   DEC   ANN #>    <chr>             <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -25.8  151.  6.01  6.49  5.79  4.67  4.12  3.77  2.46  4.87  6.11  5.5   7.97  7.03  5.39 #>  2 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -25.8  151.  5.92  5.97  5.64  4.37  4.01  3.61  2.6   4.8   5.84  5.24  7.6   6.76  5.19 #>  3 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -25.8  152.  5.92  5.97  5.64  4.37  4.01  3.61  2.6   4.8   5.84  5.24  7.6   6.76  5.19 #>  4 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -25.8  152.  5.96  5.85  5.56  4.26  3.92  3.52  2.66  4.59  5.58  4.94  7.23  6.68  5.06 #>  5 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -25.8  153.  5.96  5.85  5.56  4.26  3.92  3.52  2.66  4.59  5.58  4.94  7.23  6.68  5.06 #>  6 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -25.8  153.  6.23  6.05  5.88  4.26  3.81  3.3   2.96  4.73  5.66  5.25  7.6   7.06  5.23 #>  7 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -26.2  151.  5.97  6.65  6     4.66  4.02  3.72  2.28  4.86  6.08  5.74  7.74  6.97  5.38 #>  8 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -26.2  151.  6     6.38  5.71  4.38  4.01  3.66  2.17  4.88  6.01  5.43  7.46  6.89  5.24 #>  9 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -26.2  152.  6     6.38  5.71  4.38  4.01  3.66  2.17  4.88  6.01  5.43  7.46  6.89  5.24 #> 10 ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN  1984 -26.2  152.  5.75  5.96  5.37  4.13  3.8   3.44  2.38  4.81  5.75  4.99  6.94  6.56  4.98 #> # ℹ 134 more rows

title: nasapower
text: Climatology data can retrieved point regional areas demonstrated previously. Change temporal_api value “climatology” get data. Fetch “ag” climatology temperature relative humidity Kingsthorpe, Queensland, Australia. Note associated metadata data frame header saved data exported file format R data format, e.g., .Rdata, .rda .rds.
code: climatology_ag <- get_power(   community = "ag",   pars = c("T2M", "RH2M"),   lonlat = c(151.81, -27.48),   temporal_api = "climatology" )  climatology_ag #> NASA/POWER CERES/MERRA2 Native Resolution Climatology Climatologies   #>  20-year Meteorological and Solar Monthly & Annual Climatologies (January 2001 - December 2020)   #>  Location: Latitude  -27.48   Longitude 151.81   #>  Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = 442.77 meters  #>  The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: NA   #>  Parameter(s):   #>   #>  Parameters:  #>  T2M      MERRA-2 Temperature at 2 Meters (C) ; #>  RH2M     MERRA-2 Relative Humidity at 2 Meters (%)   #>   #> # A tibble: 2 × 16 #>     LON   LAT PARAMETER   JAN   FEB   MAR   APR   MAY   JUN   JUL   AUG   SEP   OCT   NOV   DEC   ANN #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  152. -27.5 T2M        24.7  23.7  22.0  19.0  15.1  12.6  11.6  13.1  16.9  20    22.3  23.7  18.7 #> 2  152. -27.5 RH2M       64.7  69.6  71.1  70.5  69.1  75.1  70.4  63.1  59.8  59.4  60.3  63.4  66.4

what: Interrogating the API for available parameters
title: nasapower
text: POWER API offers functionality get detailed information parameter offered parameters offered given community temporal API. can used find available parameter names definitions community temporal API. Fetch complete available information temperature 2 metres Earth’s surface, T2M. Fetch complete temporal community specific attribute information “T2M” “ag” community “hourly” temporal API.
code: query_parameters(pars = "T2M") #> $T2M #> $T2M$temporal #> $T2M$temporal$HOURLY #> $T2M$temporal$HOURLY$name #> [1] "Temperature at 2 Meters" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$HOURLY$definition #> [1] "The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth." #>  #> $T2M$temporal$HOURLY$communities #> [1] "AG" "RE" "SB" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$HOURLY$calculated #> [1] FALSE #>  #>  #> $T2M$temporal$DAILY #> $T2M$temporal$DAILY$name #> [1] "Temperature at 2 Meters" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$DAILY$definition #> [1] "The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth." #>  #> $T2M$temporal$DAILY$communities #> [1] "AG" "RE" "SB" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$DAILY$calculated #> [1] FALSE #>  #>  #> $T2M$temporal$MONTHLY #> $T2M$temporal$MONTHLY$name #> [1] "Temperature at 2 Meters" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$MONTHLY$definition #> [1] "The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth." #>  #> $T2M$temporal$MONTHLY$communities #> [1] "AG" "RE" "SB" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$MONTHLY$calculated #> [1] FALSE #>  #>  #> $T2M$temporal$CLIMATOLOGY #> $T2M$temporal$CLIMATOLOGY$name #> [1] "Temperature at 2 Meters" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$CLIMATOLOGY$definition #> [1] "The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth." #>  #> $T2M$temporal$CLIMATOLOGY$communities #> [1] "AG" "RE" "SB" #>  #> $T2M$temporal$CLIMATOLOGY$calculated #> [1] FALSE #>  #>  #>  #> $T2M$type #> [1] "METEOROLOGY" query_parameters(pars = "T2M",                  community = "ag",                  temporal_api = "hourly") #> $T2M #> $T2M$type #> [1] "METEOROLOGY" #>  #> $T2M$temporal #> [1] "HOURLY" #>  #> $T2M$source #> [1] "MERRA2" #>  #> $T2M$community #> [1] "AG" #>  #> $T2M$calculated #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $T2M$inputs #> NULL #>  #> $T2M$units #> [1] "C" #>  #> $T2M$name #> [1] "Temperature at 2 Meters" #>  #> $T2M$definition #> [1] "The average air (dry bulb) temperature at 2 meters above the surface of the earth."

title: NASA POWER API Client
text: Please note {nasapower} source NASA POWER data. API client allows easy access data. {nasapower} redistribute data provide way, encourage users follow requests POWER Project Team properly acknowledge data rather citing package (unless actually used work). POWER data products used publication, request following acknowledgement included: “data obtained National Aeronautics Space Administration (NASA) Langley Research Center (LaRC) Prediction Worldwide Energy Resource (POWER) Project funded NASA Earth Science/Applied Science Program.” previous statement properly cites POWER data different citation {nasapower}. cite R package, {nasapower}, please use output citation(package = "nasapower") cite package manual, includes version used paper refers peer-review software package functionality package changed likely change match API future necessary.

title: NASA POWER API Client
text: {nasapower} aims make quick easy automate downloading NASA-POWER global meteorology, surface solar energy climatology data R session tidy data frame tibble object analysis use modelling purposes. POWER (Prediction Worldwide Energy Resource) data freely available download varying spatial resolutions dependent original data several temporal resolutions depending POWER parameter community. Note data static may replaced improved data. Please see https://power.larc.nasa.gov/docs/services/ detailed information regard.

title: NASA POWER API Client
text: Fetch daily “ag” community temperature, relative humidity precipitation January 1, 1985 Kingsthorpe, Queensland, Australia.
code: library("nasapower") daily_ag <- get_power(   community = "ag",   lonlat = c(151.81, -27.48),   pars = c("RH2M", "T2M", "PRECTOTCORR"),   dates = "1985-01-01",   temporal_api = "daily" ) daily_ag ## NASA/POWER CERES/MERRA2 Native Resolution Daily Data   ##  Dates (month/day/year): 01/01/1985 through 01/01/1985   ##  Location: Latitude  -27.48   Longitude 151.81   ##  Elevation from MERRA-2: Average for 0.5 x 0.625 degree lat/lon region = 442.77 meters  ##  The value for missing source data that cannot be computed or is outside of the sources availability range: NA   ##  Parameter(s):   ##   ##  Parameters:  ##  RH2M            MERRA-2 Relative Humidity at 2 Meters (%) ; ##  T2M             MERRA-2 Temperature at 2 Meters (C) ; ##  PRECTOTCORR     MERRA-2 Precipitation Corrected (mm/day)   ##   ## # A tibble: 1 × 10 ##     LON   LAT  YEAR    MM    DD   DOY YYYYMMDD    RH2M   T2M PRECTOTCORR ##   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int> <int> <int> <date>     <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> ## 1  152. -27.5  1985     1     1     1 1985-01-01  54.7  24.9         0.9

what: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: Get POWER global meteorology surface solar energy climatology data return tidy data frame tibble::tibble() object.  options offered official POWER API supported.  Requests formed submit one request per point. need make synchronous requests multiple parameters single point regional request.  See section “Rate Limiting” .

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
code: get_power(   community = c("ag", "re", "sb"),   pars,   temporal_api = c("daily", "monthly", "hourly", "climatology"),   lonlat,   dates = NULL,   site_elevation = NULL,   wind_elevation = NULL,   wind_surface = NULL,   time_standard = c("LST", "UTC") )

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: community case-intensive character vector providing community name: “AG”, “RE” “SB”.  See argument details . pars case-intensive character vector solar, meteorological climatology parameters download.  requesting single point x, y coordinates, maximum twenty (20) pars can specified one time, “DAILY”, “MONTHLY” “climatology” temporal_apis.  temporal_api specified “hourly” 15 pars can specified single query.  See temporal_api .  values checked internally validity sending query POWER API. temporal_api case-intensive character vector providing temporal API end-point data queried, supported values “hourly”, “DAILY”, “MONTHLY” “climatology”. Defaults “DAILY”.  See argument details . lonlat numeric vector geographic coordinates cell region entered x, y (longitude, latitude) coordinates.  See argument details . dates character vector start end dates order,e.g., dates = c("1983-01-01", "2017-12-31"). used whentemporal_api set “climatology”. See argument details . site_elevation user-supplied value elevation single point metres.  provided return corrected atmospheric pressure value adjusted elevation provided.  used lonlat single point x, y coordinates, use “global” regional request. wind_elevation user-supplied value elevation single point metres.  Wind Elevation values Meters required 10m 300m.  used lonlat single point x, y coordinates, use “global” regional request.  parameter provided, wind-surface parameter required request, see https://power.larc.nasa.gov/docs/methodology/meteorology/wind/. wind_surface user-supplied wind surface corrected wind-speed supplied.  See wind-surface section detail. time_standard POWER provides two different time standards: Universal Time Coordinated (UTC): standard time measure used world. Local Solar Time (LST): 15 degree swath represents solar noon middle longitude swath. Defaults LST.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: data frame POWER.Info class, extension tibble::tibble, object POWER data including location, dates (including “climatology”) requested parameters.  decorative header metadata included object.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: associated metadata shown decorative header saved data exported file format native R data format, e.g., .Rdata, .rda .rds.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: three valid values, one must supplied.  affect units parameter temporal display time series data. ag Provides access Agroclimatology Archive, contains industry-friendly parameters formatted input crop models. sb Provides access Sustainable Buildings Archive, contains industry-friendly parameters buildings community include parameters multi-year monthly averages. re Provides access Renewable Energy Archive, contains parameters specifically tailored assist design solar wind powered renewable energy systems.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: four valid values. hourly hourly average pars hour, day, month year, time zone LST default. daily daily average pars day, month year. monthly monthly average pars month year. climatology Provide parameters 22-year climatologies (solar) 30-year climatologies (meteorology); period climatology monthly average, maximum, /minimum values.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: single point get specific cell, 1/2 x 1/2 degree, supply length-two numeric vector giving decimal degree longitude latitude order data download,e.g., lonlat = c(-179.5, -89.5). regional coverage get region, supply length-four numeric vector lower left (lon, lat) upper right (lon, lat) coordinates, e.g., lonlat = c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) order given region, e.g., bounding box south western corner Australia: lonlat = c(112.5, -55.5, 115.5, -50.5).  *Maximum area processed 4.5 x 4.5 degrees (100 points). global coverage get global coverage “climatology”, supply “global” also specifying “climatology” temporal_api.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: one date provided, treated start date end date single day's values returned, e.g., dates = "1983-01-01".  temporal_api set “MONTHLY”, use two year values (YYYY), e.g. dates = c(1983, 2010).  argument used temporal_api set “climatology” ignored set.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: 17 surfaces may used corrected wind-speed values using following equation: $$ WSC_hgt = WS_10m\times(\frac{hgt}{WS_50m})^\alpha$$ Valid surface types described . vegtype_1 35-m broadleaf-evergreen trees (70% coverage) vegtype_2 20-m broadleaf-deciduous trees (75% coverage) vegtype_3 20-m broadleaf needleleaf trees (75% coverage) vegtype_4 17-m needleleaf-evergreen trees (75% coverage) vegtype_5 14-m needleleaf-deciduous trees (50% coverage) vegtype_6 Savanna:18-m broadleaf trees (30%) & groundcover vegtype_7 0.6-m perennial groundcover (100%) vegtype_8 0.5-m broadleaf shrubs (variable %) & groundcover vegtype_9 0.5-m broadleaf shrubs (10%) bare soil vegtype_10 Tundra: 0.6-m trees/shrubs (variable %) & groundcover vegtype_11 Rough bare soil vegtype_12 Crop: 20-m broadleaf-deciduous trees (10%) & wheat vegtype_20 Rough glacial snow/ice seaice Smooth sea ice openwater Open water airportice Airport: flat ice/snow airportgrass Airport: flat rough grass

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: POWER API endpoints limit queries prevent server overloads due repetitive rapid requests. find API throttling queries, suggest investigate use limit_rate() ratelimitr create self-limiting functions respect rate limits API place.  considered best practice check POWER website latest rate limits differ temporal APIs may change time project matures.

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: https://power.larc.nasa.gov/docs/methodology/ https://power.larc.nasa.gov

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
text: Adam H. Sparks adamhsparks@gmail.com

title: Get NASA POWER Data From the POWER API — get_power
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  # Fetch daily "AG" community temperature, relative humidity and # precipitation for January 1 1985 at Kingsthorpe, Queensland, Australia ag_d <- get_power(   community = "AG",   lonlat = c(151.81, -27.48),   pars = c("RH2M", "T2M", "PRECTOTCORR"),   dates = "1985-01-01",   temporal_api = "DAILY" )  ag_d  # Fetch single point climatology for air temperature ag_c_point <- get_power(   community = "AG",   pars = "T2M",   c(151.81, -27.48),   temporal_api = "climatology" )  ag_c_point  # Fetch interannual solar cooking parameters for a given region sse_i <- get_power(   community = "RE",   lonlat = c(112.5, -55.5, 115.5, -50.5),   dates = c("1984", "1985"),   temporal_api = "MOHTHLY",   pars = c("CLRSKY_SFC_SW_DWN", "ALLSKY_SFC_SW_DWN") )  sse_i }

what: nasapower: NASA POWER API Client — nasapower-package
title: nasapower: NASA POWER API Client — nasapower-package
text: API client NASA POWER global meteorology, surface solar energy climatology data API. POWER (Prediction Worldwide Energy Resources) data freely available download varying spatial resolutions dependent original data several temporal resolutions depending POWER parameter community. work funded NASA Earth Science Directorate Applied Science Program. data , methodologies used creating, web- based data viewer web access, please see https://power.larc.nasa.gov/.

title: nasapower: NASA POWER API Client — nasapower-package
text: Maintainer: Adam H. Sparks adamhsparks@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: Scott Chamberlain myrmecocystus@gmail.com (ORCID) (Scott Chamberlain reviewed nasapower rOpenSci, see <https://github.com/ropensci/software-review/issues/155>.) [reviewer] Hazel Kavili (Hazel Kavili reviewed nasapower rOpenSci, see <https://github.com/ropensci/software-review/issues/155>.) [reviewer] Alison Boyer (Alison Boyer reviewed nasapower rOpenSci, see <https://github.com/ropensci/software-review/issues/155>.) [reviewer] Fernando Miguez femiguez@iastate.edu (ORCID) (Fernando Miguez provided assistance identifying improper missing value handling POWER data, see <https://github.com/femiguez/apsimx/pull/26>.) [contributor] Maëlle Salmon (ORCID) (Maëlle Salmon contributed patch fix issues using R package, 'vcr', testing API queries, see <https://github.com/ropensci/nasapower/pull/64>.) [contributor] Phillip D. Alderman phillip.alderman@okstate.edu (ORCID) (Phillip Alderman contributed patch fix issue , '`file` argument `vroom()` must use `()` literal data vroom 1.5.0.', see <https://github.com/ropensci/nasapower/pull/67>.) Sparks' time.) [copyright holder]

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameter Groupings — query_groupings
Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameter Groupings — query_groupings
text: global Boolean; query return global parameter groupings attribute information?  Defaults FALSE returning details point data.

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameter Groupings — query_groupings
text: list object information parameter groupings POWER  API.

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameter Groupings — query_groupings
text: Adam H. Sparks, adamhsparks@gmail.com

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameter Groupings — query_groupings
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  # fetch groupings for parameters query_groupings()  # fetch groupings for global parameters query_groupings(global = TRUE) }

what: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
text: Queries POWER API returning detailed information available parameters.  list available parameters, use parameters

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
code: query_parameters(community = NULL, pars, temporal_api = NULL, metadata = FALSE)

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
text: community optional character vector providing community name: “ag”, “sb” “re”. pars required character string single solar, meteorological climatology parameter query. temporal_api optional character vector indicating temporal API end-point data queried, supported values “hourly”, “daily”, “monthly” “climatology”. metadata Boolean; retrieve extra parameter metadata?  applicable supply community temporal_api, values provided ignored.  Defaults FALSE.

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
text: list object information requested parameter(s) (requested), community(ies) temporal API(s).

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
text: four valid values. hourly hourly average pars hour, day, month year. daily daily average pars day, month year. monthly monthly average pars month year. climatology Provide parameters 22-year climatologies (solar) 30-year climatologies (meteorology); period climatology monthly average, maximum, /minimum values.

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
text: Adam H. Sparks, adamhsparks@gmail.com

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Available Parameters — query_parameters
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  # fetch the complete set of attribute information for "T2M". query_parameters(pars = "T2M")  # fetch complete temporal and community specific attribute information # for "T2M" in the "ag" community for the "hourly" temporal API. query_parameters(pars = "T2M",                  community = "ag",                  temporal_api = "hourly")  # fetch complete temporal and community specific attribute information # for all parameters in the "ag" community for the "hourly" temporal API. query_parameters(community = "ag",                  temporal_api = "hourly") }

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Wind Type Surfaces — query_surfaces
Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Wind Type Surfaces — query_surfaces
text: surface_alias optional character vector providing wind surface alias available POWER API.  values returned value provided.

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Wind Type Surfaces — query_surfaces
text: list object information requested wind surface(s).

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Wind Type Surfaces — query_surfaces
text: Adam H. Sparks, adamhsparks@gmail.com

title: Query the POWER API for Detailed Information on Wind Type Surfaces — query_surfaces
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  # fetch all wind surface information query_surfaces()  # fetch surface information for `airportgrass` query_surfaces(surface_alias = "airportgrass") }

title: nasapower 4.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-02

title: nasapower 4.2.0
text: Two new functions added: query_surfaces(): Query POWER API Detailed Information Wind Type Surfaces query_groupings(): Query POWER API Detailed Information Available Parameter Groupings query_parameters now allows retrieve rich metadata parameters. Error, warning informational messages now formatted {cli} attractive informative messages. username passed along POWER API now “nasapower4r” support packages built {nasapower} use {vcr} tests. Previously user agent string took version {nasapower} appended , e.g., “nasapower410” v4.1.0. breaks tests packages relying {nasapower} due incompatibilities cassettes, affecting functionality.

title: nasapower 4.2.0
text: Fixes bug allowed users send requests API hourly data region. API support client now provides user-friendly error attempted.

title: nasapower 4.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-12-05

title: nasapower 4.1.0
text: Fix formula documentation didn’t display properly HTML. Fix non-functional link documentation. Fix code coverage badging.

title: nasapower 4.1.0
text: Use {cli} {rlang} clear messages end users. Use argument matching function arguments practical. temporal_api argument get_power() now defaults “daily”, previously default value. temporal_average argument get_power() now removed deprecated issuing message users use temporal_api instead since release 4.0.0.

title: nasapower 4.0.11
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-19

title: nasapower 4.0.11
text: Replaces & | proper && ||. Corrects documentation titles functions title case. Fixes CRAN badge README. Updates {vcr} configuration files testing.

title: nasapower 4.0.11
text: Reorder README stress data source cited . Tidy minor bits-n-pieces documentation make nicer, e.g., grammar corrections, using \dQuote{} rather ““” ROxygen. Uses sprintf() rather paste() possible. Update {vcr} configuration infrastructure use .json cassettes.

title: nasapower 4.0.9

title: nasapower 4.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-12-18 Fixes tests use vcr skipped CRAN.

title: nasapower 4.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-12-19 Update checks number parameters requested user, maximum 15 hourly 20 temporal APIs. Return API messages user assist troubleshooting error occurs server-side, see Issue 55. list POWER parameters can queried API, parameters, now alphabetical order. Add paragraph vignette describing work possible rate limiting API endpoints using ratelimitr. place internally rate-limiting due way ratelimitr handles function creation fact rate limits extremely generous may change project matures.

title: nasapower 4.0.1 (unreleased on CRAN)
text: Fixes bug NA values improperly handled. Thanks @femiguez Pull Request fix.

title: nasapower 4.0.1 (unreleased on CRAN)
text: Enforces API limits client-side API limits unique queries 30 per 60 seconds found reported @camwur Issue 57. can adjusted future releases nasapower POWER API changes indicated possible. (Re)enables vcr better unit testing. comprehensive unit tests.

title: nasapower 4.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-23

title: nasapower 4.0.0
text: Adds support new NASA POWER API v2.0, includes new hourly data major changes API available data. See https://power.larc.nasa.gov/ fully detailed changes data. Drops support deprecated NASA POWER API V1.0. Previous versions nasapower longer functional. Adds new function, query_parameters() fetch information API individual available community/temporal API combination parameters. Removes SSE community, replaced RE. Removes global option geographic coverage passed along latlon argument get_power(). Directly parse data API response rather downloading data disk importing. get_power() arguments changed: wind_elevation, wind_surface, temporal_average argument superseded temporal_api align terminology used POWER API. temporal_average argument still work, however, message given user still uses temporal_average alert user change ask update scripts.

title: nasapower 4.0.0
text: Improved documentation. Removes internal references ICASA format files longer supported client.

title: nasapower 2.0.0
text: Following UNIX-like philosophy, release removes functionality write APSIM .met DSSAT ICASA files disk. nasapower now fetch appropriate data return tibble() object -session, please use apsimx POWER web API data access viewer, https://power.larc.nasa.gov/data-access-viewer/, fetching /writing .met .icasa files, respectively. Note create_icasa() ideally deprecated, server responding properly queried time current release nasapower function removed. Add ability get_power() accept user-provided site_elevation parameter passed API. used return corrected atmospheric pressure value adjusted elevation provided.

Provides access three communities, AG, SSE SB, just AG Uses new ‘POWER’ ‘API’ download new 1/2 x 1/2 degree data Adds function get_power() get weather data optionally metadata well Adds function create_met() create ‘APSIM’ met objects ‘POWER’ data Adds function create_icasa() create text file weather data use ‘DSSAT’ crop modelling Internally, replaces httr package crul
